attributes.action: STOP LETTING AGENTS FEES FOR TENNANTS
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Fees such as reference checking are being charged at prices up to £200 + VAT per person. Why should the tennant pay those fees when that is a service for the landlord? Tennants are not asking to be referenced, the landlord is. And you can also get charged £100 + VAT just to be given a copy of the tennancy agreement, a document that can be found on the internet for free. On top of that, there are letting agents that charge nearly £50 + VAT to renew the tennancy. All they have to do is print out another copy of the cover sheet and change the dates! How is that worth £50. Tennants should not pay letting agents fees, landlords should as they are the ones being represented.
